Headlines: Bangladesh to get 100 MW power from India from December
Descriptions: New Delhi: Bangladesh will start getting 100 MW electricity daily from Palatana Power Station in Tripura of India from next month.Additional Secretary of Bangladesh Power Ministry Ahmed Kaikuas told reporters on Saturday emerging from a secretary-level meeting between Bangladesh and India here.Bangladesh Power Secretary Monwarul Islam led the Bangladesh side
Articles:
Bangladesh to get 100 MW power from India from December Observer Online Desk Published :Saturday, 28 November, 2015, Time : 8:37 PM View Count : 7 New Delhi: Bangladesh will start getting 100 MW electricity daily from Palatana Power Station in Tripura of India from next month.



Additional Secretary of Bangladesh Power Ministry Ahmed Kaikuas told reporters on Saturday emerging from a secretary-level meeting between Bangladesh and India here.



Bangladesh Power Secretary Monwarul Islam led the Bangladesh side at the meeting that discussed progress of ongoing power projects of the two neighbouring countries.



Kaikuas said Bangladesh is already getting 500 MW power from Bheramara Grid. India has given consent to provide 500 MW more electricity from the same line, he said.



During the meeting, officials of the two sides discussed the progress of construction of 1200 MW power station in Rampal of Bangladesh with the assistance of India.



Besides, discussion was held about construction of 3000 MW power station in Bangladesh by two private companies of India.



BSS/RI
Summaries:
Bangladesh to get 100 MW power from India from December Observer Online Desk Published :Saturday, 28 November, 2015, Time : 8:37 PM View Count : 7 New Delhi: Bangladesh will start getting 100 MW electricity daily from Palatana Power Station in Tripura of India from next month.
Additional Secretary of Bangladesh Power Ministry Ahmed Kaikuas told reporters on Saturday emerging from a secretary-level meeting between Bangladesh and India here.
Bangladesh Power Secretary Monwarul Islam led the Bangladesh side at the meeting that discussed progress of ongoing power projects of the two neighbouring countries.
During the meeting, officials of the two sides discussed the progress of construction of 1200 MW power station in Rampal of Bangladesh with the assistance of India.
Besides, discussion was held about construction of 3000 MW power station in Bangladesh by two private companies of India.

Headlines: UK denounces Bogra mosque attack
Descriptions: Voicing shock at the attack at a Shia mosque in Bogra, British High Commissioner in Dhaka Robert W Gibson on Friday said nothing can justify such attacks on people expressing their faith or beliefs.
Articles:
UK denounces Bogra mosque attack Published :Saturday, 28 November, 2015, Time : 12:00 AM View Count : 8

Voicing shock at the attack at a Shia mosque in Bogra, British High Commissioner in Dhaka Robert W Gibson on Friday said nothing can justify such attacks on people expressing their faith or beliefs.

"I am appalled at the savage attack on worshippers during prayer time in a mosque near Bogra; nothing can justify such attacks on people expressing their faith or beliefs," he said in a statement.

The diplomat extended his deepest condolences to the victims and their families saying this is the latest in a series of 'violent extremist' incidents in Bangladesh.

"Recent events, including in Paris, Mali, and Beirut show that no country is immune from such attacks and reinforce the need for international cooperation to tackle both the immediate threat and the root causes of such extremism," he said.

The gun attack in the Shia mosque left its muazzin dead and injured three devotees at Haripur village in Shibganj upazila on Thursday. ?UNB

Articles:
Man held with passports, cash in city Staff Correspondent Published :Saturday, 28 November, 2015, Time : 12:00 AM View Count : 4 RAB detained a man and seized 27 passports and Tk 350,500 in cash from him at the city's Uttara on Friday.

The detained person was identified as Shahidul Islam, 40.

A press release of RAB-1 said that a team of RAB, on a tip off, arrested Shahidul with passports and cash from Sector 3, Road 15 of Uttara at around 9:00am.

Shahid admitted that he, using fake information, had been collecting passports and money from different types of people for many years.

After seizing passports, he used to demand money from the owners.

The passports were being used for criminal activities.
